posts.title: Building Offline-First Applications
posts.excerpt: Learn how to use Service Workers and Workbox to create resilient web applications that work without an internet connection.
posts.content:
Offline functionality is a core pillar of Progressive Web Apps. Service Workers act as a proxy between your web app and the network, allowing you to intercept requests and serve cached content.

In this article, we explore strategies like Cache-First, Stale-While-Revalidate, and how to handle background sync for a truly resilient user experience.

posts.title: Mastering CSS Grid and Flexbox
posts.excerpt: A comprehensive guide to creating responsive, modern layouts using the most powerful CSS tools available today.
posts.content:
Layout design has evolved tremendously. CSS Grid provides a two-dimensional layout system that handles rows and columns with ease, while Flexbox excels at one-dimensional space distribution.

Combining both allows for complex, responsive designs that look beautiful on any device size. We'll show you the secret patterns for perfect alignment.

posts.title: UnitTest
posts.excerpt: A unit test verifies the accuracy of the smallest, isolated parts of an application—typically functions or methods—to ensure they behave as expected.
posts.content:
Key Aspects of Unit Testing
Isolation: Units are tested in isolation, often using stubs or mocks to replace dependencies like databases or APIs.
Automation & Speed: Unit tests are typically automated and run frequently during development to provide instant feedback.
Structure: Follows the "Arrange, Act, Assert" (AAA) pattern: setting up the data, running the function, and verifying the result.
Focus: Tests both valid, invalid, and edge cases to ensure robust behavior. 
Benefits
Early Bug Detection: Finds errors in the development phase, reducing long-term debugging costs.
Easier Refactoring: Acts as a safety net, allowing code changes without breaking existing functionality.
Documentation: Serves as living documentation for how the code is supposed to work. 
Tools and Frameworks
Python: unittest, pytest.
JavaScript: Jest, Vitest, Mocha.
Java/C#: JUnit, NUnit. 
Effective unit tests are typically fast, reliable, and cover various execution paths to ensure code quality.
